segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, To identify the purpose and status of the Insurance claim solicitorï¿½s instruction message, such as instruction, progress report, resolution details.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, To identify the version of the message implementation guide being used in the application.

segment.name: Sequence details
segment.documentation: SEQ, To identify the sequence number of the message in a series of messages relating to the same claim, incident or action.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Contains the creation date of the message.

segment.name: External file link identification
segment.documentation: EFI, To enable cross reference to electronic files containing photographic or video files associated with this message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: Contains details of one policy under which the claim was reported. Required when the message type is instruction.

segment.name: Insurance cover description
segment.documentation: ICD, To identify the class of policy.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, Contains monetary amounts relating to the policy excesses and indemnity limits.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, Identifies the type of indemnity provided, and the area of jurisdiction specified by the policy.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, To specify reference numbers which are specific to the policy, e.g. policy number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, To specify the start and end dates for the cover under the policy.

segment.name: Query and response
segment.documentation: QRS, Used to convey whether indemnity is unlimited and whether there was a previous policy in force.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, Contains a text description of the reason why policy cover is at issue and the legal venue specified in the policy.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: SG5 A group of segments used to identify all the parties involved in the transaction. The group will be used in all identified transaction types.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, Contains the name of the party in text or a coded identification of the name and address of the party together with the role of the party in the message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, To specify those references which are specific to the party, e.g. national insurance number.

segment.name: Employment details
segment.documentation: EMP, Contains a coded description of the occupation or business of the party.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Indicates dates which are relevant to the party, e.g. date of birth, date exposure commenced.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, To specify percentages applicable to the party, e.g. co- insurers proportion.

segment.name: Query and response
segment.documentation: QRS, Used to convey whether the party is registered for value added tax or under a legal disability.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, Provides a textual description of the function of a party in a message.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, Provides the communication number and channel for a contact party. Note: where the communication details are linked to an address they should be included in the address group.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, Contains a coded identification or text description of an attribute of the party, e.g. title, gender, trading status.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: Contains address details for the party and communication information related to that address. Note: if the address is included in the coded identification of the party it does not need to be repeated here.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, Contains the address type and details for the party.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, Contains a communication number and type of communication for the party at the address, e.g. telephone number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: Contains details and amounts relating to quantum applicable to the party in respect of damage, loss or injury caused to the party by the insured risk.

segment.name: Risk object type
segment.documentation: ROD, Contains the type of quantum in respect of the damage, injury or loss caused to the party by the insured risk.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, Contains the monetary amount and status of the quantum.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, Contains the text description of the type of quantum, required if non-standard and no code available.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: Contains details of convictions sustained by the party.

segment.name: Component details
segment.documentation: COD, Identifies the group as containing conviction information.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, Identifies the type of sentence.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, Makes reference to other parties related to the offence.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, Contains a reference which uniquely identifies the conviction.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Contains the date of the conviction and periods relating to the conviction, e.g. length of disqualification.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, Contains the monetary amount of a fine resulting from the conviction.

segment.name: Number of units
segment.documentation: EQN, Contains the number of penalty points relating to the conviction.

segment.name: Query and response
segment.documentation:
QRS, Advises whether the conviction is related to the claim which is the subject of the message.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A service segment placed at the start of the detail section to avoid segment collision.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments containing details of the claim event.

segment.name: Event
segment.documentation: EVE, Contains a qualifier identifying the segment as claim/loss.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, Contains the location or addresses relevant to the claim event.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, Identifies the claim number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Contains dates relating to the claim event, e.g. incident start and end date.

segment.name: Query and response
segment.documentation: QRS, Used to convey information relevant to the claim such as whether the solicitor has delegated authority, whether aggregate indemnity/excess or indemnity is at issue, whether the claim is a recovery etc.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, Contains a text description of the claim. e.g. claim circumstances.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: Contains the type, status and amount of a recovery or the type and amount of reserve applicable to the claim.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, Contains the type and status of a recovery or the type of reserve.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, Contains the monetary amount of the reserve or recovery.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments containing information relating to payments in connection with the claim or dispute resolution.

segment.name: Payment terms
segment.documentation: PYT, Contains a coded identification or textual description of the nature of the monetary value, also whether it is a payment or receipt.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, Contains the payment/receipt amount.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, Contains the full name of the payee.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, Contains the financial institution account number and sort code of the payee.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, Contains a coded identification of the payment status, e.g. payment made, make payment etc.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, Contains the roll number, accounting reference of the payee and a coded identification of the party to whom the payment should be sent.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments containing information relating to a dispute resolution in connection with the claim.

segment.name: Component details
segment.documentation: COD, Contains a coded identification of the method of dispute resolution, e.g. Crown Court, Civil County Court, mediation etc.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, To specify coded attributes relating to the dispute resolution.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, Contains the reference of the dispute resolution.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, Contains the address details or location where the dispute resolution is to be held. Note: this is used where the address or location is not related to a party, e.g. an inquest may be held at any suitable location such as a cinema or local hall.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Contains dates relevant to the dispute resolution e.g. proceedings issue date, dispute resolution date etc.

segment.name: Query and response
segment.documentation: QRS, Used to request whether there are other proceedings in force.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, Contains a textual description of the dispute resolution or other proceedings.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments containing information relating to progress in connection with a dispute resolution.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, Identifies the type of progress, e.g. trial, close of pleadings etc.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, Contains a coded identification of the status of progress and/or coroner verdict.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, Contains the unique identifying reference of a party associated with the progress.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Contains dates relevant to the progress, e.g. response date progress as at date etc.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, Contains details of a monetary amount related to the progress.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, Contains a textual description of progress.
